dialogues.text: JENNIFER I don't feel like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL You've been inside all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JENNIFER I don't feel like it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't feel like explaining everything fifteen times to somebody who's too bored and silly to listen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer turns and runs up the stairs, upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April lets out a defeated sigh. She turns to the kitchen see to the supper. Steam rises from the vegetables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stands in the entrance silently watching for a mome

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She carries a pot of steaming, overcooked vegetables to t sink, slops them into a colander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK I don't believe you. Did something happen today or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Nothing happened today that I haven't known about for days and days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Oh God, Frank, please don't look so dense. Do you mean you haven't guessed or anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finally stops and looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL I'm pregnant, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat as he absorbs it.    He's totally blind-sided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?   Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Oh, Frank, I meant to wait until dinner to tell you, but I just - well, I've been pretty sure all week and today I went to the Doctor and now I can't even pretend it's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (still stunned) Jesus... How long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK You didn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought... Oh, I don't know what I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares, still unsure how he feels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL (CONT'D) I'm sorry, Frank. I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK I know you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him, with slight desperation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL We don't have to let this stop us. There are things we can do. Remember that girl at school I told you about...? As long as you do it before 12 weeks, it's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just looks at her and his silence makes her desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL (CONT'D) We've got to be together in this, Frank. Otherwise nothing's going to make any sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   We'll figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 12 weeks.    So we have time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Frank's face... Slowly, he smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL I love you Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK ...I love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A baking hot day. The sky is electric blue. Radios PLAY, children CRY, dogs BARK. Sunbathers cover almost every in of sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We find Shep, Milly, Frank and April with beach chairs, coolers and umbrellas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A child wrapped in a towel sleeps on Milly's lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April wears a pair of dark glasses, behind which she is thinking, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEP So, Frank, how's work?   They gonna survive without you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Actually... Something kinda funny happened the other day. I did some dumb little piece of work to get myself off the hook with Bandy, and suddenly I'm The Bright Young Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEP (laughs) That's always the way, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK It's incredible. I knocked this thing off in a couple of minutes and now they want me to join their team of `specialist' salesmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEP Morons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK It'd be funny, if they weren't talking about so much damn money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April turns and looks at Frank. Long and hard.   If he ca feel her look, he doesn't show it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEP (stealing a glance at April) So, you tempted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Well, it's kind of ironic, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April suddenly stands up.    Frank and Shep watch her wal to the water's edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stares after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April stands in the water staring out over the sea. The waves break against her ankles. Whether it occurs to her not, she's staring in the direction of Europe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank comes up beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL I thought you turned the job down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (shrugs) Not yet... It's just an option, that's all. With the money they're talking, things could be different for us here. We could get a better place. Travel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April shakes her head and drags on her cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (CONT'D) Look, the point is - we could be happy here. At least for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares out at the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (CONT'D) It is possible that Parisians aren't the only ones who know how to lead interesting lives, April.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL So you've made up your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Like I said, it's an option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL ...And supposing you're right. You make all this money and we have this interesting life here. Won't you still be wasting your life toiling away at a job you find ridiculous? Just like your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (sharp) Maybe we let that be my business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL (incredulous) Your business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (exhales) It's too hot for this.    I'm going to get wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just looks at him. He walks into the ocean.   She sta on the shore, watching him swim away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April paces the family room. Her hair is a defiant mess. She still wears her bathing suit under her clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windows are open, and most of the lights are off. It' very hot night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL You don't want to go, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Come on, April.   Of course I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL You don't! Because you've never tried at anything. And if you don't try at anything you can't fail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK What the hell do you    mean I don't try? I support you,     don't I? I pay for this house.     I work ten hours a day at a job    I can't stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL You don't have to!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Bullshit! I'm not happy about it. But I have the backbone not to run away from my responsibilities!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL It takes backbone to lead the life you want, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head and gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL (CONT'D) Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Is it alright with you if I go to the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She disgustedly twists out her cigarette, and immediately lights another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank splashes water on his face like a boxer between rou He looks up at his reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for a towel, but there isn't one. He turns to shelf behind him and pulls down a fresh towel. Something catches his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches to the back and retrieves a small brown paper package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens it, his face slowly registering what it means...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April wheels around as -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank storms in, a rubber syringe in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you going to do with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL And what do you think you're going to do? You're going to stop me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK You're damn right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Go ahead and try!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes at her across the room with the syringe in his h She moves away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Listen. Listen to me. You do this - you do this and I swear to God I'll -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL You'll what? You'll leave me?   Is that a threat, or a promise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes it in her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK When did you buy this, April?   I want to know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL You know you really are being melodramatic about the whole thing. As long as it's done in the first twelve weeks, it's perfectly safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK That's now April!   Don't I get a say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Of course you do! It would be for you, Frank, don't you see? So you can have time. Like we talked about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK How can it be for me if the thought makes my stomach turn over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Then it's for me... Tell me we can have the baby in Paris, Frank. But don't make me stay here. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK We can't have the baby in Paris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Why not? I don't need everything we have here. I don't care where we live! I mean who made these rules, anyway? The only reason we moved out here was because I got pregnant. Then we had another child to prove the first one wasn't a mistake. I mean how long does it go on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL (CONT'D) Frank. Do you actually want another child? Well, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL (CONT'D) Come on, tell me. Tell me the truth, Frank. Remember that? We used to live by it. You know what's so good about the truth? Everyone knows what it is, however long they've lived without it. No one forgets the truth, Frank, they just get better at lying. So tell me: do you really want another child?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank turns towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK All I know is what I feel. And anyone else in their right mind would feel the same way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL (quiet) But I've had two children.    Doesn't that count in my favor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Christ! The fact that you even put it that way! You make it sound like having children is a punishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL I love my children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK And you're sure about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL What the hell is that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK April, you just said our daughter was mistake. How do I know you didn't try to get rid of her, or Michael for that matter? How do I know you didn't try to flush our entire fucking family down the toilet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL No that's not true. Of course I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK But how do I know April?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.   Please just stop, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK April, a normal woman, a normal sane mother doesn't buy herself a piece of rubber tubing to give herself an abortion so she can, go live out some God damn fantasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (CONT'D) (sober) All I'm saying is you don't seem entirely rational about this thing... And maybe we should get someone to help you think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL ...And the new job's going to pay for that too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK April if you need a shrink, it'll be paid for. Obviously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April turns to the book shelves.   Her back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank waits, his heart beating quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL ...Okay. I guess there isn't much more to say, then, is there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes are bright with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL (CONT'D) So I guess Paris was a pretty childish idea, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything hangs on Frank's answer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK I guess maybe it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April closes her eyes. Tears run down her cheeks.   He wa over to her, but he doesn't touch her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (CONT'D) We can be happy here April...   I can make you happy here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cries quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (CONT'D) We've had a great few months.   It doesn't have to end...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (CONT'D) We're going to be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL I hope so Frank.   I really hope so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stands at the picture window watching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April approach the children. She squats on the ground so can be at their height and talks to them. Michael tries t get into her arms. Jennifer turns away and walks sulkily across the grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks into his coffee cup.   He doesn't look like a who won an argument.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits smoking nervously in an oak-paneled waiting ro The door opens behind him. He gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RECEPTIONIST Thank you for waiting.   Mr. Pollock can see you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He follows her through the door.    The door closes behin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the scene in dumb-show through the glass door. Bar looks up as Frank enters. An "I knew it all along" smile spreads across Pollock's face. He offers his hand to Fran Frank smiles thinly. They shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK (O.S) Foiled by faulty contraception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, Ed, Vince and Jack sit in the same booth in the sa crowded luncheonette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stares out the window.   The others can't contain themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ED I can't say I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VINCE Wouldn't have been the same without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK You'd have been sorely missed in the old cubicle, I can tell you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his glass, drinks alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK (CONT'D) Besides which...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK ...Well, the plan always seemed a touch unrealistic, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank glares with barely contained fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK (CONT'D) I suppose, it's none of my business, really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I suppose it isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK Well, we won't be the only ones glad to hear the news. They'll be celebrating in the secretarial pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and Vince chuckle.   Frank's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two drumsticks spinning in a spotlight.   They click out rhythm, and crash into a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut back to reveal a small, low-ceilinged joint. On-stage are the Steve Kovack quartet, four perspiring middle-aged with day jobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNGISH COUPLES, and the odd middle-aged COUPLE navigate dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smattering of lost SINGLES line the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wheelers and Campbells sit squashed into a booth on t side of the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several empty glasses have accumulated. Milly is beating edge of the table with red drink straws. She's a few drin ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have to SHOUT over the MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILLY Hey! Remember the first time you brought us here? You said, it takes a special kind of taste to enjoy Vito's Log Cabin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEP It's so awful it's kinda nice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILLY That's right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh at the old joke.   Then Milly begins to weep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILLY (CONT'D) (dabs at her eyes) Look at me...! I'm just so happy. Our little gang's back together again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knocks her drink back.    The number finishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEP At least Europe's not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April stares out at the dance floor.    Frank looks at he new number starts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Wanna dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL I don't really feel like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILLY I'll dance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milly takes him by the hand and pulls him away. Shep and April watch. Then Shep turns his attention to April.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILLY (CONT'D) (tipsy) Guess April's pretty blue `bout Paris, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Think she'll be okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILLY Oh, sure. Give us girls a couple of days and we can get over anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank turns his attention to Milly. He's a good dancer. H movements are fast and aggressive, his mind on April.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milly is a little too drunk, and hurries to keep up, perspiring through her dress. He spins her around and around, back and forth into his arms. Milly begins to loo slightly dizzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't hear her over the music, or he doesn't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank... I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sudden remorse) You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee...I'm afraid I'm not very...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her body spasms with the need to be sick. She turns and rushes for the lady's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank leads the way through the cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep supports Milly who is now falling down drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April walks alone a few paces behind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach Shep's car, which is trapped behind several ot cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of all the inconsiderate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.   Frank looks to April.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Look - why don't you take Milly home, then go home yourself and that would take care of both sitters. Then Shep can take me home later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEP All right with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (to April) You'll be alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank holds April's look an instant, then walks away with keys in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve Kovack performs an exhausting, sweat-drenched drum solo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April and Shep now sit alone in the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEP I'm sorry you're not going away anymore. I know it was important to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April distantly nods her thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEP (CONT'D) Don't take this wrong; I've been there and...they don't have so much we don't have here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL It didn't have to be Paris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep sips his beer, trying to figure out how to connect w her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEP You just wanted out, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL I wanted in. I just wanted us to live again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep nods, not entirely sure what she means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL (CONT'D) For years I thought we shared a secret...that we would be wonderful in the world. I didn't exactly know how, but just the possibility...kept me hoping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a long slug of her drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL (CONT'D) How pathetic is that? To put all your hopes in a promise that was never made? See, Frank knows...he knows what he wants. He's found his place. He's just fine. Married, two kids. It should be enough. It is for him. He's right; we were never special or destined or anything at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEP Sure you are. You're The Wheelers. You're a terrific couple, everyone says so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April doesn't hear, she's pursuing her thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw a different life. I can't stop seeing it. (beat) Can't leave, can't stay. (beat) No damn use to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April turns and stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band strikes up a new number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL (CONT'D) Come on, let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April and Shep dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep can't dance well, but he's trying. April, on the oth hand, is a wonderful dancer. She dances out as far as the joined hands allow and does a little twitching, hip-bobbi curtsies before twisting back, all seemingly effortless. is joyous, released.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep slips behind the wheel and is immediately kissing he groping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEP Let me take you somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Please. Here.    Now.    In the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She climbs into the back seat. He pulls off his jacket an climbs in after her. He folds the jacket under her head f a pillow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She remains perfectly still, allowing him to kiss her, to search under her clothing, to kiss her skin and finally, lift her skirt and pull her clothing aside and make love her against the vinyl seat cover...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As suddenly as it began, it's over. Shep collapses agains her. April stares into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEP (CONT'D) April... This is what I've always wanted... I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Don't say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEP I mean it, I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Please, just be quiet for a minute, then you can take me home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They begin to quietly assemble themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stands at the mirror putting on a clean shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April stands at the kitchen table chopping vegetables. wears an unflattering floral dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stands in the doorway watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK It's beautiful out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Yes; it's lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances at the calendar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK You know what today is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (CONT'D) It's twelve weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks over to her.   He takes her in his arms.   She stiffens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Look, this has been kind of a crazy summer. We've both been under a strain. I mean I know you're upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL You know I'm not sleeping with you and you want to know why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks him straight in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL (CONT'D) Well, I'm sorry Frank, but I don't really feel like talking about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls herself free of his grasp. He watches as she ad the vegetables in the pot on the stove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Okay. What do you feel like talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Would it be all right if we didn't talk about anything? Can't we just take each day as it comes, and do the best we can, and not feel we have to talk about everything all the time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles patiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I suggested we talk about everything all the time. My point was, we've both been under a strain and we ought to be trying to help each other as much as we can right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's utterly uninterested and it's making him nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (CONT'D) I mean God knows my own behavior has been pretty weird lately... I mean, as it happens... there is actually something I'd like to tell you about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues folding the napkins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been with a girl in the city a few times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, she stops moving.   She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (CONT'D) A girl I hardly even know. It was nothing to me, but she got a little carried away. She's just a kid... Anyway, it's over now. It's really over. If I weren't sure of that I guess I could never have told you about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Why did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (relieved) Baby, I don't know. I think it was a simple case of wanting to be a man again after all that abortion business. Some kind of neurotic, irrational need to prove something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL No. I don't mean why did you have the girl; I mean why did you tell me about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is suddenly unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL (CONT'D) I mean what's the point? Is it supposed to make me jealous, or something? Is it supposed to make me fall in love with you, or back into bed with you, or what? I mean what am I supposed to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries that same patient smile, but it's not convincing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Why don't you say what you feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL I don't feel anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK In other words you don't care what I do or who I fuck or anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL No; I guess that's right; I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is frighteningly calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL (CONT'D) Fuck who you like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His panic mounts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Don't you see...Don't you see, I want you to care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Oh, I know you do. And I suppose I would if I loved you. But you see I don't think I do anymore. And I only just figured that out. And that's why I'd just as soon not do any talking right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes back into the kitchen. Frank follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Oh, now don't give me this shit! You know God damn well you love me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL You think so?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK You know GOD DAMN WELL!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoo-hoo!   Any one home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and April stare at each other, breathless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and the Givings' sit with cocktails. It's painfully awkward. Moving boxes are everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL I'm sorry dinner's late. Can I get anyone a refill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. GIVINGS Oh, don't worry. It's nice just to sit for a bit and socialize...You really didn't need to go through all the trouble of cooking. I can see you have a lot to do with packing and what not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks at April. She avoids his look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Actually, there's been a change of plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. GIVINGS Oh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks at April.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK I thought maybe it was obvious... April's pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April manages a forced smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. GIVINGS Oh, April! I can't tell you how pleased I am. Oh, but I expect you'll be needing a bigger house, now, won't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN Hold it a second, Ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN (CONT'D) I don't get this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fixes Frank with the stare of a prosecuting attorney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN (CONT'D) What's so obvious about it? I mean okay, she's pregnant; so what? Don't people have babies in Europe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh John, really. I don't think we need to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John holds up a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN I'm asking the man a question. If he doesn't want to give me the answer, I'm assuming he'll have sense enough to tell me so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Suppose we just say that people anywhere aren't very well advised to have babies unless they can afford them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN (nods slowly) Okay. Okay; it's a question of money. Money's always a good reason...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John paces the room, with his hands behind his back like detective at a murder scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN (CONT'D) But it's hardly ever the real reason. What's the real reason? Wife talk you out of it, or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns the force of his smile on April.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN (CONT'D) Little woman decide she isn't quite ready to quit playing house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks across the room and stabs out her cigarette. immediately lights another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN (CONT'D) Nah, nah, that's not it. I can tell. She looks too tough. Tough and female and adequate as hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swings around to face Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN (CONT'D) Okay, then; it must've been you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stares back defiantly.   Rage bubbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN (CONT'D) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. GIVINGS John, please, you're being very --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John holds up his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN What happened, Frank? You get cold feet, or what? You decide you're better off here after all? You figure it's more comfy here in the old Hopeless Emptiness after all, or --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN (CONT'D) Wow, that did it! Look at his face! What's the matter, Wheeler? Am I getting warm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stares at John, his rage increasing.   Mr. Givings to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. GIVINGS (CONT'D) All right, son. I think we'd better be --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN Boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets out his braying laugh.   April starts to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN (CONT'D) Boy! You know something? I wouldn't be surprised if you knocked her up on purpose just so you could spend the rest of your life hiding behind that maternity dress. That way you never have to find out what he's made of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Now look, I think that's just about enough out of you. I mean, who the hell do you think you are? You come in here and say whatever crazy God damn thing comes into your head and I think it's about time someone told you to keep your God damn -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. GIVINGS He's not well, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Not well, my ass! I don't give a damn if he's sick or well or dead or alive, he should keep his fucking opinions in the fucking insane asylum where they belong!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April stares at Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. GIVINGS Let's go, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Givings moves John towards the door. Mrs. Givings slo stands. April is the only one left seated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN Big man you got there, April.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He winks at April and puts his hat on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN (CONT'D) Big family man, solid citizen. I feel sorry for you. Still, maybe you deserve each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN (CONT'D) Matter of fact, the way you look right now, I'm beginning to feel sorry for him, too. I mean, you must give him a pretty bad time, if making babies is the only way he can prove he's got a pair of balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK You... fucking..!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank lunges at John. Mr. Givings tries to hold Frank bac Mrs. Givings leaps between them. She's crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. GIVINGS He's not well, Frank!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.   Mr. Givings slowly releases Frank.   He is breathing heavily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. GIVINGS All right, John. Let's get on out to the car now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He guides him from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. GIVINGS I'm sorry April, I'm so sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN Right... Sorry, sorry, sorry! Okay Ma? Have I said `Sorry' enough times? I am sorry, too. Damn; I bet I'm just about the sorriest bastard I know. Course, get right down to it, I don't have a whole hell of a lot to be glad about, do I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes another step towards the door, then stops and tu back, laughing again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN (CONT'D) Hey, but I'm glad about one thing, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points a yellow-stained finger at April's stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN (CONT'D) You know what I'm glad about? I'm glad I'm not gonna be that kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank goes to the liquor cabinet, pours a whiskey and dri it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April watches him from across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Okay, okay, don't tell me. Don't tell me; let me guess. I made a Disgusting Spectacle of Myself. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to April.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK And everything that man said is True. Right? Isn't that what you're going to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Apparently I don't have to.     You're saying it for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK But you're wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Why am I wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Because the man is insane. He's fucking insane! Do you know what the definition of insanity is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL What is it, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK The inability to relate to another human being. It's the inability to love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him.    Then she begins to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL The in -- the in; the inabil; the inability to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reels around the room, her laughter increasingly out control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL (CONT'D) Oh. -- Oh, Frank, you really are a wonderful talker! If black could be made into white by talking, you'd be the man for the job. So now I'm crazy because I don't love you -- right? Is that the point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK No. Wrong. You're not crazy and you do love me; that's the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a step towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the laughter goes out of her face.   She backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL But I don't. In fact I loathe the sight of you. You're just a boy who made me laugh at a party once and if you come any closer, if you touch me or anything I think I'll scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her by the arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Oh baby listen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She SCREAMS. High and shrill.    Her eyes wide open, cold perfectly calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (CONT'D) Fuck you, April. And fuck all your hateful, snotty little -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slips past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls a chair into his path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SLINGS it against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL What're you going to do now? Are you going to hit me? To show how much you love me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Oh, no, don't worry, I can't be bothered! You're not worth the trouble it'd take to hit you. You're not worth the powder it'd take to blow you up. You're an empty --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins to shake with anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (CONT'D) You're an empty, hollow fucking shell of a woman. What the hell are you living in my house for if you hate me so much? Huh? Will you answer me that? Why the hell do you fuck me? What the hell are you carrying my child for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points at her belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (CONT'D) Why the hell didn't you just get rid of it, when you had the chance? Because listen. Listen: I got news for you. I wish to God you had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He strides out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank enters the bedroom and slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He paces, slowly calming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits on the bed with his head in his hands... His mind racing. Then he's on his feet again. He rushes for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank enters, running, but the kitchen is empty.   Frank out of the room into living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The living room is empty.   He goes straight for the fron door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank bursts out the front and comes to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's across the street - climbing unsteadily into the woods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank breaks into a sprint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April walks through the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank runs up behind her, scrambling through the muddy bracken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April wheels around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Don't come any closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK April, listen, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Don't come any closer. Can't I even get away from you in the fucking woods?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK April, listen, I didn't mean that. Honestly; I didn't mean what I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Are you still talking? Isn't there any way to stop your talking? I NEED to think. Can't you see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She backs up against a tree trunk, looking down at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Please come back.     What're you doing out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Do you want me to scream again, Frank? Because I will, if you say another word! I mean it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank has no choice - they're outside. The neighbors woul hear and call the police. He reluctantly backs away, then turns back the way he came, glancing over his shoulder as goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stands at the window watching the section of woods where he left April.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, he sees her come back across the street. She walks around the side of the house. He turns and runs into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank goes to the window. He watches April walk up into t yard and stop against a tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank pours a drink and takes the bottle with him to the window. He looks out, drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the darkness, he can make out the glow of April's cigarette deep in the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank falls back on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's now very drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes close as he slips into unconsciousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank wakes alone.     He looks around the room.   His he throbbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stands in the doorway dressed for work.      He sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen has been tidied and is bathed in sunlight. table has been carefully set for two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April stands at the stove wearing a fresh maternity dress She seems serene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April turns and looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands there frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Would you like scrambled eggs or fried?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Oh. It doesn't really matter - Uh... scrambled, I guess, if it's easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.   I'll have scrambled too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and April sit across the kitchen table, eating.   F several moments, only the sound of their cutlery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's kinda nice having breakfast without the kids for a change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April reaches out to pour him some orange juice.   Her ha shake slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I thought you'd probably want a good breakfast today. I mean it's kind of an important day for you, isn't it? Isn't this the day you have your conference with Pollock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Yes. That's right, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I imagine it is a pretty big deal; for them, anyway. What exactly do you think you'll be doing? You never have told me much about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't I? Well... I think this whole thing is about Knox getting ready to buy up one of these really big computers, bigger than the `500'. Did I tell you about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't believe you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know -- Basically it's just a...a big, fast adding machine. Only...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a pencil from his inside pocket and delicately sketches the computer on the napkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead of mechanical parts, you see, it's got thousands of little individual vacuum tubes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up the drawing and looks at it.       It's surp delicate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I see. At least I think I see; yes. It's really sort of -- interesting, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know, it's -- yeah, I guess it is sort of interesting, in a way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should value what you do Frank. You're obviously good at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles, flattered and surprised.    He slips the penci the inside pocket of his suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess I'd better be getting started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands.    April stands up too, smoothing her skirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, though, April; this was really nice... I mean it was a swell breakfast. Really; I don't know when I've ever had a -- a nicer breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Thank you... I'm glad; I enjoyed it too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand there gazing at one another across the table. Suddenly, inexplicably, his eyes are filled with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and walks to the door. He puts his hand on the handle and turns back once more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Then you don't -- You don't hate me, or anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL No; of course I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL (CONT'D) Have a good day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans down and kisses her tenderly.   They look at one another a moment longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Okay, then... So long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps through the door. She catches the door before it shuts and watches him through the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April walks out onto the driveway as the car reverses awa down the drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank backs the car onto the road. He slides the car into drive and then catches sight of April in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April sees Frank looking back at her.    She waves.   Fra waves from the car and drives off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then April is alone. She shivers from the morning chill. She turns and looks back at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April enters through the screen door and goes to the tabl She looks down at Frank's diagram and carefully places it aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She carries the dishes to the sink and begins to wash the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, her body convulses as she tries to hold back fr crying. And then there is no stopping the tears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April is standing by the phone, with her hand on the receiver, rehearsing. She is smoking. She dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL Hello... Milly? Everything all right? My voice sounds what...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April uses both hands to grip the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL (CONT'D) Well, no, I'm afraid I'm not feeling any better... If it's not an inconvenience for you... This evening would be great. What...? Oh, well- no, not if they're outdoors playing. Don't call them in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cigarette shreds in April's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL (CONT'D) Just give them - you know, give them each a kiss for me, and give them my love, and tell them - you know... All right, Milly. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up and begins to cry again.   Takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move behind April as she walks through the silent hous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The distant SOUND of children playing outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each room she passes is a pocket of silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April makes the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She arranges her shoes on the floor of the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April reaches onto a shelf behind some clothes.   Pulls o the brown paper package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April stands at the stove over a pot of rolling, boiling water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She removes the rubber syringe from its paper packaging a drops it into the pot. She checks her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April carries the pot of boiling, sudsy water down the ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April places the pot into the tub.   She lays towels acro the floor. And closes the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND of running water. The empty mirror.     April's rises up into the reflection with a gasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move with April down the hallway, her face is pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now April stands at the picture window.    She is shaking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DROPLET of blood slides down her knee.   She looks down

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the floor, two droplets of blood appear between her ba feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we see the bright maple leaf of blood seeping through skirt. She is shaking more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks slowly out of the room, towards the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APRIL (O.S.) I think I need an ambulance.... Yes... One one five Revolutionary Road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milly folds laundry. She looks up to see -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ambulance turns into the Wheeler's driveway.   Her fac clouds with instinctual foreboding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep steps out into a hospital hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank paces, helpless in the waiting room, his face a mas bewildered, childlike confusion. He looks up to see -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep coming towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEP Frank? They tell you what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK Jesus, Shep. I couldn't even understand half the things he told me. He said the fetus was out before they got her here. He said they had to operate to take out the whatdycallit, the placenta and now she's still bleeding. He said she'd lost a lot of blood before the ambulance came, and now they're trying to stop it, and he said a whole lot of things I didn't get, about capillaries, and he said she's unconscious. Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEP How about sitting down, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK What the hell do I want to sit down for!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   Take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEP Here, have a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep offers the pack.   Frank doesn't take one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK She did it to herself, Shep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep's face as he realizes what he's saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (CONT'D) She did it to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep takes a cigarette for himself.   He lights it with trembling fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEP I'll get some coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks over at Shep as if he'd forgotten him.   He n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep stands and walks down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep stands at a coffee machine, gathering himself. He lo up. He begins to feed coins into the machine. His hands a trembling. He drops a coin. It rolls under the machine. H has to get down on his hands and knees to retrieve it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep walks tentatively, holding a cup in each hand, slopp coffee onto the floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rounds the corner and stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is no longer in his chair at the end of the long echoing hallway. Shep looks around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then suddenly, the double doors are flung open and a numb of nurses hurry out. Behind them, comes Frank, supported two Doctors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep runs to them as they move Frank over to a chair. in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   No.   No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They try to make him sit, but he stays stubbornly on his feet, the chair skidding behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCTOR Try to sit down, Mr. Wheeler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEP Sit down Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks at Shep - his face is a terrifying blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A toyland of white and pastel houses along the road. The crisp green lawns. The blue televisions flickering behind the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the WHISK of running footsteps on the asphalt, th rush of a man's breath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is running down the middle of the street, tears streaming silently down his face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four high-ball glasses with glistening cubes of ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep puts the finishing touches on four drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. and MRS. BRACE, a pleasant looking young couple fresh from the city sit on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It was the worst experience of my life. Such wonderful people. Weren't they Shep? Poor April.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep picks up the drinks and carries them across the room He stands there beside the three of them, but he can't br himself to sit down and join in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank lives in the city now.       Where is it he works?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart Pollock Associates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computers.     Interesting firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Brace removes his pipe and looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen him since?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Too many memories, I think. Shep's seen him. In the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILLY (CONT'D) He's just dedicated to those kids. Every spare moment he has, he spends with them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep turns and walks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep walks across the lawn to the edge of the property. H looks out over the suburban houses. At what was once the Wheeler house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep's face, looking out. His eyes are filled with tears. Milly comes up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes his arm and holds him close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEP (CONT'D) I don't want to talk about The Wheelers any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILLY Okay. We don't have to.     We don't have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep and Milly look out over Revolutionary Road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same silence over a beautiful day in the city.    And from the silence, the faint sound of wind through the lea branches of trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two children play in a playground in a small park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Jennifer and Michael.    They seem happy, engrossed. kids play around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching them from a bench is Frank.   He is a little old little thinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on Frank's face.   The SOUND of his children playin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Givings crouches on a cotton work sheet painting var onto a chair. Mr. Givings sits reading the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new puppy sleeps curled up on the rug nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. GIVINGS I can't tell you how pleased I am about the little Revolutionary Road place, Howard. Remember how dreary it looked all winter? All cold and dark and -- well, spooky. Creepy- crawly. And now whenever I drive past, it gives me such a lift to see it all perked up and spanking clean again, with lights in the windows. And do you know, I was just thinking, I've loved that little house for years, and the Braces are the first really suitable people I've ever found for it. Really nice, congenial people, I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Givings fiddles with his hearing aid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. GIVINGS Well, except for the Wheelers, you mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. GIVINGS Oh, I was very fond of the Wheelers but they always were a bit -- a bit whimsical, for my taste. A bit neurotic. I may not have stressed it, but they were often very trying people to deal with, in many ways. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. GIVINGS (CONT'D) Actually, the main reason the little house has been so hard to sell is that they let it depreciate so dreadfully. Warped window frames, wet cellar, crayon marks on the walls, filthy smudges around all the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Givings reaches up to his ear and SUDDENLY... SILENCE but for the faint sound of wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gazes out the window as behind him Mrs. Givings contin to talk, but we can't hear a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has turned off his hearing aid.
